alert.note: Alert for Southampton (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 14 at 6:51AM EST until further notice by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Nottoway River At Sebrell affecting Southampton County. For the Chowan Basin...including Sebrell...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nottoway River at Sebrell. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Water crosses Indian Town Road and US Highway 58 Business in Courtland. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 AM EST Sunday the stage was 19.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:15 AM EST Sunday was 19.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 19.8 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall early tomorrow afternoon. It will rise to 19.7 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.7 feet on 09/08/2000. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM EST.
